snippet: Food companies would be better off voluntarily labeling genetically modified foods than fighting the passage of state laws.
abstract: Editorial contends it would be better if food companies decided whether and how to inform consumers about genetically modified foods rather than requiring them by law to label such foods, as ballot initiative in Washington State is attempting to do; urges food industry to adopt such labels voluntarily; holds consumers are not likely to avoid them since they have been eating genetically engineered food for years without harm.
lead_paragraph: Food companies would be better off voluntarily labeling genetically modified foods than fighting the passage of state laws.
